sentence: COLUMBUS — “I say we can bring Ohio back,” former Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley states in his first television ad, part of a campaign that repeatedly emphasizes the “comeback” he says his city has experienced and Ohio will experience if he is elected governor.
author: Jim Provance
title: Democrat launches ad in Ohio governor race

sentence: Whaley is running for the Democratic nomination for governor against former Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley, who is running with Fedor.
author: Anna Staver
title: Democrats introduce bill to mandate universal Pre-K for all Ohio children

sentence: Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley and his running mate, state Sen. Theresa Fedor, D-Toledo, told reporters on Monday that the state has a “moral obligation” to pay for students to hit the books this summer, if they so choose.
author: Susan Tebben
title: Ohio Gov. Candidate John Cranley Pushes Summer School to Account for Covid Learning Loss

sentence: The winner of the Republican primary will face the Democratic nominee, either former Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley or ex-Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley.
title: Ohio's GOP governor aims to overcome anger in party base

sentence: The winner of the Republican primary will face the Democratic nominee, either former Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley or ex-Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley.
author: Portsmouth Daily Times
title: Ohio’s GOP governor aims to overcome anger in party base

author: Associated Press
title: DeWine aims to overcome anger in party base
